introduction: The following passage is adapted from Medieval Innovations by Josephine Clarke (2018).
text: During the twelfth century, engineers designed massive waterwheels along the river. Their rotating paddles harnessed the current to grind grain, an innovation that ______ local agriculture to flourish.
question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English? Pay attention to verb tense and the cause-and-effect implied in the sentence.
explanation: Choice B is correct because we are describing a historical innovation that allowed local agriculture to thrive, so the past tense enabled is appropriate. A enables places the action in the present, which is inaccurate historically. C are enabling uses the plural subject incorrectly (the innovation is singular) and is present tense. D will enable suggests a future effect, which doesnâ€™t match the historical context.
